trans-unit.source: Wrap iOS apps with the App Wrapping Tool | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Wrap iOS apps with the App Wrapping Tool | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to learn how to wrap your iOS apps without modifying the code of the app itself.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to learn how to wrap your iOS apps without modifying the code of the app itself.

trans-unit.source: Prepare the apps so you can apply mobile app management policies.
trans-unit.target: Prepare the apps so you can apply mobile app management policies.

trans-unit.source: Prepare iOS apps for mobile application management with the Intune App Wrapping Tool
trans-unit.target: Prepare iOS apps for mobile application management with the Intune App Wrapping Tool

trans-unit.source: Use the **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS** to modify the behavior of in-house iOS apps by restricting features of the app without changing the code of the app itself.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS** to modify the behavior of in-house iOS apps by restricting features of the app without changing the code of the app itself.

trans-unit.source: The tool is a Mac OS command-line application that creates a ‘wrapper’ around an app.
trans-unit.target: The tool is a Mac OS command-line application that creates a ‘wrapper’ around an app.

trans-unit.source: Once an app is processed, you can then change the app's functionality using [mobile application management policies](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md) that you configure.
trans-unit.target: Once an app is processed, you can then change the app's functionality using [mobile application management policies](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md) that you configure.

trans-unit.source: To download the tool, see [Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk/intune-app-wrapping-tool-ios).
trans-unit.target: To download the tool, see [Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk/intune-app-wrapping-tool-ios).

trans-unit.source: The version of the app wrapping tool, which supports devices not enrolled in Intune, is available for public preview.
trans-unit.target: The version of the app wrapping tool, which supports devices not enrolled in Intune, is available for public preview.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to participate in the public preview, you can download the tool from [this github page](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk/intune-app-wrapper-ios-preview) for iOS.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to participate in the public preview, you can download the tool from [this github page](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk/intune-app-wrapper-ios-preview) for iOS.

trans-unit.source: The scenario is described in the [Protect LOB apps on devices not enrolled in Intune](protect-line-of-business-apps-and-data-on-devices-not-enrolled-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: The scenario is described in the [Protect LOB apps on devices not enrolled in Intune](protect-line-of-business-apps-and-data-on-devices-not-enrolled-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: Step 1 Fulfill the prerequisites for using the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Step 1 Fulfill the prerequisites for using the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: Read [this blog post](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/34339.skype-for-business-online-enable-your-tenant-for-modern-authentication.aspx) to learn more about pre-requisites and how to set them.
trans-unit.target: Read [this blog post](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/34339.skype-for-business-online-enable-your-tenant-for-modern-authentication.aspx) to learn more about pre-requisites and how to set them.

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Supported operating system and toolset
trans-unit.target: Supported operating system and toolset

trans-unit.source: You must run the app wrapping tool on a Mac computer that runs OS X 10.8.5 or later, which has the XCode toolset version 5 or later installed.
trans-unit.target: You must run the app wrapping tool on a Mac computer that runs OS X 10.8.5 or later, which has the XCode toolset version 5 or later installed.

trans-unit.source: Signing certificate and provisioning profile
trans-unit.target: Signing certificate and provisioning profile

trans-unit.source: You must have an Apple signing certificate and provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: You must have an Apple signing certificate and provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: See your [Apple developer documentation](https://developer.apple.com/).
trans-unit.target: See your [Apple developer documentation](https://developer.apple.com/).

trans-unit.source: Processing an app with the App Wrapping Tool
trans-unit.target: Processing an app with the App Wrapping Tool

trans-unit.source: Apps must be developed and signed by your company, or an independent software vendor (ISV).
trans-unit.target: Apps must be developed and signed by your company, or an independent software vendor (ISV).

trans-unit.source: You cannot use this tool to process apps from the Apple Store.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use this tool to process apps from the Apple Store.

trans-unit.source: Apps must be written for iOS 8.0 or later.
trans-unit.target: Apps must be written for iOS 8.0 or later.

trans-unit.source: Apps must also be in the Position Independent Executable (PIE) format.
trans-unit.target: Apps must also be in the Position Independent Executable (PIE) format.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the PIE format, see your Apple developer documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the PIE format, see your Apple developer documentation.

trans-unit.source: Lastly, the app must have the extension **.app**, or **.ipa** format.
trans-unit.target: Lastly, the app must have the extension **.app**, or **.ipa** format.

trans-unit.source: Apps the wrapping tool cannot process
trans-unit.target: Apps the wrapping tool cannot process

trans-unit.source: Encrypted apps, unsigned apps, and apps with extended file attributes.
trans-unit.target: Encrypted apps, unsigned apps, and apps with extended file attributes.

trans-unit.source: Setting entitlements for your app
trans-unit.target: Setting entitlements for your app

trans-unit.source: You must set entitlements, which give the app additional permissions and capabilities beyond those typically granted, before you wrap the app.
trans-unit.target: You must set entitlements, which give the app additional permissions and capabilities beyond those typically granted, before you wrap the app.

trans-unit.source: See [Setting app entitlements](#setting-app-entitlements) for instructions.
trans-unit.target: See [Setting app entitlements](#setting-app-entitlements) for instructions.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 Install the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Step 2 Install the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: From the **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS** page on the [Microsoft Download Center](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=45218), download the installation file for the app wrapping tool to a Mac computer.
trans-unit.target: From the **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS** page on the [Microsoft Download Center](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=45218), download the installation file for the app wrapping tool to a Mac computer.

trans-unit.source: On the Mac computer, double-click the installation file **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS.dmg**.
trans-unit.target: On the Mac computer, double-click the installation file **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS.dmg**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Agree** to accept the End User License Agreement (EULA).
trans-unit.target: Choose **Agree** to accept the End User License Agreement (EULA).

trans-unit.source: The installer is mounted and displayed on the Mac computer.
trans-unit.target: The installer is mounted and displayed on the Mac computer.

trans-unit.source: Open the installer and copy the displayed files to a new folder on the Mac computer.
trans-unit.target: Open the installer and copy the displayed files to a new folder on the Mac computer.

trans-unit.source: You can now disconnect the mounted installer drive.
trans-unit.target: You can now disconnect the mounted installer drive.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to run the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to run the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 Run the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Step 3 Run the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: On the Mac computer, open a Terminal window and navigate to the folder where you saved the files.
trans-unit.target: On the Mac computer, open a Terminal window and navigate to the folder where you saved the files.

trans-unit.source: Because the executable resides inside the package, you’ll need to run the command as follows:
trans-unit.target: Because the executable resides inside the package, you’ll need to run the command as follows:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: -h
trans-unit.target: -h

trans-unit.source: Displays the available command-line properties for the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: Displays the available command-line properties for the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: -i
trans-unit.target: -i

trans-unit.source: Specifies the path and file name of the input app.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the path and file name of the input app.

trans-unit.source: -o
trans-unit.target: -o

trans-unit.source: Specifies the path in which to save the processed app.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the path in which to save the processed app.

trans-unit.source: -p
trans-unit.target: -p

trans-unit.source: Specifies the path to your provisioning profile for iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the path to your provisioning profile for iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: -c
trans-unit.target: -c

trans-unit.source: Specifies the SHA1 hash of the signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the SHA1 hash of the signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: -v
trans-unit.target: -v

trans-unit.source: Output verbose messages to the console (Optional).
trans-unit.target: Output verbose messages to the console (Optional).

trans-unit.source: -f
trans-unit.target: -f

trans-unit.source: Optional)
trans-unit.target: Optional)

trans-unit.source: -b
trans-unit.target: -b

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Do not specify an argument to this flag if you want the wrapped app to have the same bundle version as the input app (not recommended).
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Do not specify an argument to this flag if you want the wrapped app to have the same bundle version as the input app (not recommended).

trans-unit.source: Use “-b <custom bundle version>” if you want the wrapped app to have a custom CFBundleVersion.
trans-unit.target: Use “-b <custom bundle version>” if you want the wrapped app to have a custom CFBundleVersion.

trans-unit.source: We recommend incrementing the native app’s CFBundleVersion by the least significant component, eg.
trans-unit.target: We recommend incrementing the native app’s CFBundleVersion by the least significant component, eg.

trans-unit.source: The -f and -b flags are only supported in the public preview version of the App Wrapping tool that supports MAM on devices that are not enrolled in Intune .
trans-unit.target: The -f and -b flags are only supported in the public preview version of the App Wrapping tool that supports MAM on devices that are not enrolled in Intune .

trans-unit.source: One way to run the App Wrapping Tool is to put all the command arguments into a [plist](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/PropertyLists/Introduction/Introduction.html) file.
trans-unit.target: One way to run the App Wrapping Tool is to put all the command arguments into a [plist](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/PropertyLists/Introduction/Introduction.html) file.

trans-unit.source: Plist is a file format similar to XML that can help us input our command-line arguments into a key-value interface.
trans-unit.target: Plist is a file format similar to XML that can help us input our command-line arguments into a key-value interface.

trans-unit.source: Open Parameters.plist, a blank plist template, with a text editor or Xcode.
trans-unit.target: Open Parameters.plist, a blank plist template, with a text editor or Xcode.

trans-unit.source: Enter your arguments for input path, output path, provisioning profile path, SHA1 certificate hash, and verbose enabled.
trans-unit.target: Enter your arguments for input path, output path, provisioning profile path, SHA1 certificate hash, and verbose enabled.

trans-unit.source: Finally, run the IntuneMAMPackager with the plist as the sole argument:
trans-unit.target: Finally, run the IntuneMAMPackager with the plist as the sole argument:

trans-unit.source: After processing completes, the message **The application was successfully wrapped** will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: After processing completes, the message **The application was successfully wrapped** will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: If an error occurs, see [Error messages](prepare-ios-apps-for-mobile-application-management-with-the-microsoft-intune-app-wrapping-tool.md#error-messages) for help.
trans-unit.target: If an error occurs, see [Error messages](prepare-ios-apps-for-mobile-application-management-with-the-microsoft-intune-app-wrapping-tool.md#error-messages) for help.

trans-unit.source: The wrapped app is saved in the output folder you specified previously.
trans-unit.target: The wrapped app is saved in the output folder you specified previously.

trans-unit.source: You can now upload the app into [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and associate it with a mobile application management policy.
trans-unit.target: You can now upload the app into [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and associate it with a mobile application management policy.

trans-unit.source: You must upload the app as a new app.
trans-unit.target: You must upload the app as a new app.

trans-unit.source: You cannot update an older, unwrapped version of the app.
trans-unit.target: You cannot update an older, unwrapped version of the app.

trans-unit.source: You can now deploy the app to your [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] groups, and the app will now run on the device using the app restrictions you specify.
trans-unit.target: You can now deploy the app to your [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] groups, and the app will now run on the device using the app restrictions you specify.

trans-unit.source: Error messages and log files
trans-unit.target: Error messages and log files

trans-unit.source: Use the following information to troubleshoot issues you have with the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: Use the following information to troubleshoot issues you have with the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: Error messages
trans-unit.target: Error messages

trans-unit.source: If the app wrapping tool fails to complete successfully, one of the following error messages will be displayed:
trans-unit.target: If the app wrapping tool fails to complete successfully, one of the following error messages will be displayed:

trans-unit.source: Error message
trans-unit.target: Error message

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: You must specify a valid iOS provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: You must specify a valid iOS provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: Your provisioning profile might not be valid.
trans-unit.target: Your provisioning profile might not be valid.

trans-unit.source: Check to make sure you have the correct permissions for devices and that your profile is correctly targeting either development or distribution.
trans-unit.target: Check to make sure you have the correct permissions for devices and that your profile is correctly targeting either development or distribution.

trans-unit.source: Your provisioning profile might also be expired.
trans-unit.target: Your provisioning profile might also be expired.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid input application name.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid input application name.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the input application name you specified is correct.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the input application name you specified is correct.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid path to the output application.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid path to the output application.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the path to the output application you specified exists, and is correct.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the path to the output application you specified exists, and is correct.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid input provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid input provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you supplied a valid provisioning profile name and extension.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you supplied a valid provisioning profile name and extension.

trans-unit.source: Your provisioning profile might be missing entitlements or you might not have included the **–p** command-line option.
trans-unit.target: Your provisioning profile might be missing entitlements or you might not have included the **–p** command-line option.

trans-unit.source: The input application you specified was not found.
trans-unit.target: The input application you specified was not found.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid input application name and path.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid input application name and path.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your input app path is valid and exists.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your input app path is valid and exists.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the input app exists at that location.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the input app exists at that location.

trans-unit.source: The input provisioning profile file you specified was not found.
trans-unit.target: The input provisioning profile file you specified was not found.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid input provisioning profile file.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid input provisioning profile file.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the path to the input provisioning file is valid and that the file you specified exists.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the path to the input provisioning file is valid and that the file you specified exists.

trans-unit.source: The output application folder you specified was not found.
trans-unit.target: The output application folder you specified was not found.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid path to the output application.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid path to the output application.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the output path you specified is valid and exists.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the output path you specified is valid and exists.

trans-unit.source: Output app does not have .ipa extension.
trans-unit.target: Output app does not have .ipa extension.

trans-unit.source: Only apps with the **.app** and **.ipa** extensions are accepted by the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: Only apps with the **.app** and **.ipa** extensions are accepted by the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your output file has a valid extension.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your output file has a valid extension.

trans-unit.source: An invalid signing certificate was specified.
trans-unit.target: An invalid signing certificate was specified.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid Apple signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid Apple signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you’ve downloaded the correct signing certificate from the Apple developer portal.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you’ve downloaded the correct signing certificate from the Apple developer portal.

trans-unit.source: Your certificate might also be expired.
trans-unit.target: Your certificate might also be expired.

trans-unit.source: If your Apple certificate and provisioning profile can be used to correctly sign an app within Xcode, then they are valid for the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: If your Apple certificate and provisioning profile can be used to correctly sign an app within Xcode, then they are valid for the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: The input application you specified is invalid.
trans-unit.target: The input application you specified is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid application.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid application.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have a valid iOS application that has been compiled as an .app or .ipa file.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have a valid iOS application that has been compiled as an .app or .ipa file.

trans-unit.source: The input application you specified is encrypted.
trans-unit.target: The input application you specified is encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid unencrypted application.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid unencrypted application.

trans-unit.source: The app wrapping tool does not support encrypted apps.
trans-unit.target: The app wrapping tool does not support encrypted apps.

trans-unit.source: Specify an unencrypted app.
trans-unit.target: Specify an unencrypted app.

trans-unit.source: The input application you specified is not in a Position Independent Executable (PIE) format.
trans-unit.target: The input application you specified is not in a Position Independent Executable (PIE) format.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid application in PIE format.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid application in PIE format.

trans-unit.source: Position Independent Executable (PIE) apps can be loaded at a random memory address when run which can have security benefits.
trans-unit.target: Position Independent Executable (PIE) apps can be loaded at a random memory address when run which can have security benefits.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see your Apple Developer documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see your Apple Developer documentation.

trans-unit.source: The input app you specified has already been wrapped.
trans-unit.target: The input app you specified has already been wrapped.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid unwrapped application.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid unwrapped application.

trans-unit.source: You cannot process an app that has already been processed by the tool.
trans-unit.target: You cannot process an app that has already been processed by the tool.

trans-unit.source: If you want to process an app again, run the tool using the original version of the app.
trans-unit.target: If you want to process an app again, run the tool using the original version of the app.

trans-unit.source: The input application you specified is not signed.
trans-unit.target: The input application you specified is not signed.

trans-unit.source: Specify a valid signed application.
trans-unit.target: Specify a valid signed application.

trans-unit.source: The app wrapping tool requires apps to be signed.
trans-unit.target: The app wrapping tool requires apps to be signed.

trans-unit.source: Consult your developer documentation to learn how to sign a wrapped app.
trans-unit.target: Consult your developer documentation to learn how to sign a wrapped app.

trans-unit.source: The input application you specified must be in the .ipa or .app format.
trans-unit.target: The input application you specified must be in the .ipa or .app format.

trans-unit.source: Only .app and .ipa extensions are accepted by the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: Only .app and .ipa extensions are accepted by the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your input file has a valid extension and has been compiled as a .app or .ipa file.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your input file has a valid extension and has been compiled as a .app or .ipa file.

trans-unit.source: The input app you specified has already been wrapped and is on the latest policy template version.
trans-unit.target: The input app you specified has already been wrapped and is on the latest policy template version.

trans-unit.source: The app wrapping tool will not rewrap an existing wrapped app with the latest policy template version.
trans-unit.target: The app wrapping tool will not rewrap an existing wrapped app with the latest policy template version.

trans-unit.source: WARNING: You did not specify a SHA1 certificate hash.
trans-unit.target: WARNING: You did not specify a SHA1 certificate hash.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that your wrapped application is signed before deploying.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that your wrapped application is signed before deploying.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you specify a valid SHA hash (using the **–c** command line property).
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you specify a valid SHA hash (using the **–c** command line property).

trans-unit.source: Log files for the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Log files for the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: Apps that have been wrapped by using the app wrapping tool generate logs which are written to the iOS client device console.
trans-unit.target: Apps that have been wrapped by using the app wrapping tool generate logs which are written to the iOS client device console.

trans-unit.source: This information is useful in situations where you are having problems with the application and need to diagnose if the issue is related to the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: This information is useful in situations where you are having problems with the application and need to diagnose if the issue is related to the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve this information, use the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To retrieve this information, use the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Reproduce the issue by running the app.
trans-unit.target: Reproduce the issue by running the app.

trans-unit.source: Collect the console output by following Apple's instructions for [Debugging Deployed iOS Apps](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/qa/qa1747/_index.html).
trans-unit.target: Collect the console output by following Apple's instructions for [Debugging Deployed iOS Apps](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/qa/qa1747/_index.html).

trans-unit.source: Filter the saved logs for App Restrictions output by entering the following script into the console:
trans-unit.target: Filter the saved logs for App Restrictions output by entering the following script into the console:

trans-unit.source: You can submit the filtered logs to Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: You can submit the filtered logs to Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: In the log file, the item ‘build version’ represents the build version of Xcode.
trans-unit.target: In the log file, the item ‘build version’ represents the build version of Xcode.

trans-unit.source: Wrapped apps will also present users the option to send logs directly from the device via email after the app crashes.
trans-unit.target: Wrapped apps will also present users the option to send logs directly from the device via email after the app crashes.

trans-unit.source: Users can send the log to you to examine and forward to Microsoft if required.
trans-unit.target: Users can send the log to you to examine and forward to Microsoft if required.

trans-unit.source: Certificate, provisioning profile, and authentication requirements
trans-unit.target: Certificate, provisioning profile, and authentication requirements

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Provisioning profile
trans-unit.target: Provisioning profile

trans-unit.source: **Make sure that the provisioning profile is valid before you include it** - The app wrapping tool does not check whether the provisioning profile is expired when processing an iOS app.
trans-unit.target: **Make sure that the provisioning profile is valid before you include it** - The app wrapping tool does not check whether the provisioning profile is expired when processing an iOS app.

trans-unit.source: If an expired provisioning profile is specified, the app wrapping tool will include the expired provisioning profile, and you will not know there is a problem until the app fails to install on an iOS device.
trans-unit.target: If an expired provisioning profile is specified, the app wrapping tool will include the expired provisioning profile, and you will not know there is a problem until the app fails to install on an iOS device.

trans-unit.source: Certificate
trans-unit.target: Certificate

trans-unit.source: **Make sure that the certificate is valid before you specify it** - The tool does not check whether a certificate is expired when processing iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: **Make sure that the certificate is valid before you specify it** - The tool does not check whether a certificate is expired when processing iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: If the hash for an expired certificate is provided, the tool will process and sign the app, but it will fail to install on devices.
trans-unit.target: If the hash for an expired certificate is provided, the tool will process and sign the app, but it will fail to install on devices.

trans-unit.source: **Make sure that the certificate provided for signing the packaged application has a match in the provisioning profile** - The tool does not validate if the provisioning profile has a match for the certificate provided for signing the wrapped application.
trans-unit.target: **Make sure that the certificate provided for signing the packaged application has a match in the provisioning profile** - The tool does not validate if the provisioning profile has a match for the certificate provided for signing the wrapped application.

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: A device must have a pin set for encryption to work.
trans-unit.target: A device must have a pin set for encryption to work.

trans-unit.source: On devices to which you have deployed a wrapped application, touching the status bar on the device will require the user to re-authenticate with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)].
trans-unit.target: On devices to which you have deployed a wrapped application, touching the status bar on the device will require the user to re-authenticate with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)].

trans-unit.source: The default policy in a wrapped application is *authentication on re-launch*.
trans-unit.target: The default policy in a wrapped application is *authentication on re-launch*.

trans-unit.source: iOS handles any external notification (for example a phone call) as exiting the app and then re-launching it.
trans-unit.target: iOS handles any external notification (for example a phone call) as exiting the app and then re-launching it.

trans-unit.source: For wrapped apps, the first user who signs into any wrapped app from the same publisher is cached.
trans-unit.target: For wrapped apps, the first user who signs into any wrapped app from the same publisher is cached.

trans-unit.source: After this point, only that user is allowed to access the app.
trans-unit.target: After this point, only that user is allowed to access the app.

trans-unit.source: To reset the user, the device has to be unenrolled and then re-enrolled.
trans-unit.target: To reset the user, the device has to be unenrolled and then re-enrolled.

trans-unit.source: Setting app entitlements
trans-unit.target: Setting app entitlements

trans-unit.source: Before wrapping your app, you can grant **entitlements** to give the app additional permissions and capabilities that exceed what an app typically can do.
trans-unit.target: Before wrapping your app, you can grant **entitlements** to give the app additional permissions and capabilities that exceed what an app typically can do.

trans-unit.source: An **entitlement file** is used during code signing to specify special permissions within your app (for example, access to a shared keychain).
trans-unit.target: An **entitlement file** is used during code signing to specify special permissions within your app (for example, access to a shared keychain).

trans-unit.source: Specific app services, called **capabilities**, are enabled within Xcode during app development.
trans-unit.target: Specific app services, called **capabilities**, are enabled within Xcode during app development.

trans-unit.source: Once enabled, the capabilities are reflected in your entitlements file.
trans-unit.target: Once enabled, the capabilities are reflected in your entitlements file.

trans-unit.source: For more information about entitlements and capabilities, see [Adding Capabilities](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/AddingCapabilities/AddingCapabilities.html) in the iOS Developer Library.
trans-unit.target: For more information about entitlements and capabilities, see [Adding Capabilities](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/AddingCapabilities/AddingCapabilities.html) in the iOS Developer Library.

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of supported capabilities, see [Supported capabilities](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/SupportedCapabilities/SupportedCapabilities.html).
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of supported capabilities, see [Supported capabilities](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/SupportedCapabilities/SupportedCapabilities.html).

trans-unit.source: Supported capabilities for the App Wrapping Tool for iOS
trans-unit.target: Supported capabilities for the App Wrapping Tool for iOS

trans-unit.source: Capability
trans-unit.target: Capability

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Recommended guidance
trans-unit.target: Recommended guidance

trans-unit.source: App Groups
trans-unit.target: App Groups

trans-unit.source: Use app groups to allow multiple apps to access shared containers and allow additional inter-process communication between apps.
trans-unit.target: Use app groups to allow multiple apps to access shared containers and allow additional inter-process communication between apps.

trans-unit.source: To enable app groups, open the **Capabilities** pane and click the **ON** switch in the **App Groups** section.
trans-unit.target: To enable app groups, open the **Capabilities** pane and click the **ON** switch in the **App Groups** section.

trans-unit.source: You can add app groups or select existing ones.
trans-unit.target: You can add app groups or select existing ones.

trans-unit.source: When using App Groups, use reverse DNS notation:
trans-unit.target: When using App Groups, use reverse DNS notation:

trans-unit.source: group.com.companyName.AppGroup
trans-unit.target: group.com.companyName.AppGroup

trans-unit.source: Background Modes
trans-unit.target: Background Modes

trans-unit.source: Enabling background modes allows your iOS app to continue running in the background.
trans-unit.target: Enabling background modes allows your iOS app to continue running in the background.

trans-unit.source: Data Protection
trans-unit.target: Data Protection

trans-unit.source: Data protection adds a level of security to files stored on disk by your iOS app.
trans-unit.target: Data protection adds a level of security to files stored on disk by your iOS app.

trans-unit.source: Data protection uses the built-in encryption hardware present on specific devices to store files in an encrypted format on disk.
trans-unit.target: Data protection uses the built-in encryption hardware present on specific devices to store files in an encrypted format on disk.

trans-unit.source: Your app needs to be provisioned to use data protection.
trans-unit.target: Your app needs to be provisioned to use data protection.

trans-unit.source: In-App Purchase
trans-unit.target: In-App Purchase

trans-unit.source: In-App purchase embeds a store directly into your app by enabling you to connect to the store and securely process payments from the user.
trans-unit.target: In-App purchase embeds a store directly into your app by enabling you to connect to the store and securely process payments from the user.

trans-unit.source: You can use In-App Purchase to collect payment for enhanced functionality or for additional content usable by your app.
trans-unit.target: You can use In-App Purchase to collect payment for enhanced functionality or for additional content usable by your app.

trans-unit.source: Keychain Sharing
trans-unit.target: Keychain Sharing

trans-unit.source: Enabling keychain sharing allows your app to share passwords in the keychain with other apps developed by your team.
trans-unit.target: Enabling keychain sharing allows your app to share passwords in the keychain with other apps developed by your team.

trans-unit.source: When using Keychain Sharing, use reverse DNS notation:
trans-unit.target: When using Keychain Sharing, use reverse DNS notation:

trans-unit.source: com.companyName.KeychainGroup
trans-unit.target: com.companyName.KeychainGroup

trans-unit.source: Personal VPN
trans-unit.target: Personal VPN

trans-unit.source: Enable personal VPN to allow your app to create and control a custom system VPN configuration using the Network Extension framework.
trans-unit.target: Enable personal VPN to allow your app to create and control a custom system VPN configuration using the Network Extension framework.

trans-unit.source: Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Apple Push Notification service (APNs) allows an app that isn’t running in the foreground to notify the user that it has information for the user.
trans-unit.target: Apple Push Notification service (APNs) allows an app that isn’t running in the foreground to notify the user that it has information for the user.

trans-unit.source: For push notifications to work, you need to use an app-specific provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: For push notifications to work, you need to use an app-specific provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps in the [Apple developer documentation](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/AddingCapabilities/AddingCapabilities.html).
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps in the [Apple developer documentation](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/AddingCapabilities/AddingCapabilities.html).

trans-unit.source: Wireless Accessory Configuration
trans-unit.target: Wireless Accessory Configuration

trans-unit.source: Enabling wireless accessory configuration adds the External Accessory framework to your project and allows your app to configure MFi Wi-Fi accessories.
trans-unit.target: Enabling wireless accessory configuration adds the External Accessory framework to your project and allows your app to configure MFi Wi-Fi accessories.

trans-unit.source: Steps to enable entitlements
trans-unit.target: Steps to enable entitlements

trans-unit.source: Enable capabilities in your app:
trans-unit.target: Enable capabilities in your app:

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, navigate to your app’s target, and click the **Capabilities** pane.
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, navigate to your app’s target, and click the **Capabilities** pane.

trans-unit.source: Turn on the appropriate capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Turn on the appropriate capabilities.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about each capability and how to determine the correct values, see [Adding Capabilities](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/AddingCapabilities/AddingCapabilities.html) in the iOS Developer Library.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about each capability and how to determine the correct values, see [Adding Capabilities](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/AddingCapabilities/AddingCapabilities.html) in the iOS Developer Library.

trans-unit.source: Note any IDs that you created during the process.
trans-unit.target: Note any IDs that you created during the process.

trans-unit.source: Build and sign your app to be wrapped.
trans-unit.target: Build and sign your app to be wrapped.

trans-unit.source: Enable entitlements in your provisioning profile:
trans-unit.target: Enable entitlements in your provisioning profile:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the Apple Developer Member Center.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the Apple Developer Member Center.

trans-unit.source: Create a provisioning profile for your app.
trans-unit.target: Create a provisioning profile for your app.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [How to Obtain the Prerequisites for the Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/enterprisemobility/2015/02/25/how-to-obtain-the-prerequisites-for-the-intune-app-wrapping-tool-for-ios/).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [How to Obtain the Prerequisites for the Intune App Wrapping Tool for iOS](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/enterprisemobility/2015/02/25/how-to-obtain-the-prerequisites-for-the-intune-app-wrapping-tool-for-ios/).

trans-unit.source: In your provisioning profile, enable the same entitlements that you have in your app.
trans-unit.target: In your provisioning profile, enable the same entitlements that you have in your app.

trans-unit.source: You will need to supply the same IDs that you specified during the development of your app.
trans-unit.target: You will need to supply the same IDs that you specified during the development of your app.

trans-unit.source: Complete the provisioning profile wizard and download your file.
trans-unit.target: Complete the provisioning profile wizard and download your file.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you have satisfied all the prerequisites, and then wrap the app.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you have satisfied all the prerequisites, and then wrap the app.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting common errors with entitlements
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting common errors with entitlements

trans-unit.source: If the App Wrapping Tool for iOS displays an entitlement error, try the following troubleshooting steps.
trans-unit.target: If the App Wrapping Tool for iOS displays an entitlement error, try the following troubleshooting steps.

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Cause
trans-unit.target: Cause

trans-unit.source: Resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution

trans-unit.source: Failed to parse entitlements generated from the input application.
trans-unit.target: Failed to parse entitlements generated from the input application.

trans-unit.source: The App Wrapping Tool cannot read the entitlements file that was extracted from the app.
trans-unit.target: The App Wrapping Tool cannot read the entitlements file that was extracted from the app.

trans-unit.source: The entitlements file might be malformed.
trans-unit.target: The entitlements file might be malformed.

trans-unit.source: Inspect the entitlements file for your app.
trans-unit.target: Inspect the entitlements file for your app.

trans-unit.source: To do so, follow the instructions detailed below.
trans-unit.target: To do so, follow the instructions detailed below.

trans-unit.source: When inspecting the entitlements file, check for any malformed syntax.
trans-unit.target: When inspecting the entitlements file, check for any malformed syntax.

trans-unit.source: The file should be in XML format.
trans-unit.target: The file should be in XML format.

trans-unit.source: Entitlements are missing in the provisioning profile (missing entitlements are listed).
trans-unit.target: Entitlements are missing in the provisioning profile (missing entitlements are listed).

trans-unit.source: Repackage the app with a provisioning profile that has these entitlements.
trans-unit.target: Repackage the app with a provisioning profile that has these entitlements.

trans-unit.source: There is a mismatch between the entitlements enabled in the provisioning profile and the capabilities enabled in the app.
trans-unit.target: There is a mismatch between the entitlements enabled in the provisioning profile and the capabilities enabled in the app.

trans-unit.source: This mismatch also applies to the IDs associated with particular capabilities (i.e., App Groups, Keychain Access etc).
trans-unit.target: This mismatch also applies to the IDs associated with particular capabilities (i.e., App Groups, Keychain Access etc).

trans-unit.source: Generally, you can create a new provisioning profile that enables the same capabilities as the app.
trans-unit.target: Generally, you can create a new provisioning profile that enables the same capabilities as the app.

trans-unit.source: When IDs between the profile and app don't match, the App Wrapping Tool will replace the IDs if it is able to.
trans-unit.target: When IDs between the profile and app don't match, the App Wrapping Tool will replace the IDs if it is able to.

trans-unit.source: If you still get this error after creating a new provisioning profile, you can try removing entitlements from the app by using the **–e** parameter (see "Using the –e parameter to remove entitlements from an app section below).
trans-unit.target: If you still get this error after creating a new provisioning profile, you can try removing entitlements from the app by using the **–e** parameter (see "Using the –e parameter to remove entitlements from an app section below).

trans-unit.source: Finding the existing entitlements of a signed app
trans-unit.target: Finding the existing entitlements of a signed app

trans-unit.source: To review the existing entitlements of a signed app and provisioning profile:
trans-unit.target: To review the existing entitlements of a signed app and provisioning profile:

trans-unit.source: Find the .ipa file and change its the extension to .zip.
trans-unit.target: Find the .ipa file and change its the extension to .zip.

trans-unit.source: Expand the .zip file.
trans-unit.target: Expand the .zip file.

trans-unit.source: This will produce a Payload folder containing your .app bundle.
trans-unit.target: This will produce a Payload folder containing your .app bundle.

trans-unit.source: Use the codesign tool to check the entitlements on the .app bundle like this:
trans-unit.target: Use the codesign tool to check the entitlements on the .app bundle like this:

trans-unit.source: where `YourApp.app` is the actual name of your .app bundle.
trans-unit.target: where `YourApp.app` is the actual name of your .app bundle.

trans-unit.source: Use the security tool to check the entitlements of the app's embedded provisioning profile:
trans-unit.target: Use the security tool to check the entitlements of the app's embedded provisioning profile:

trans-unit.source: where `YourApp.app` is the actual name of your .app bundle.
trans-unit.target: where `YourApp.app` is the actual name of your .app bundle.

trans-unit.source: Using the –e parameter to remove entitlements from an app
trans-unit.target: Using the –e parameter to remove entitlements from an app

trans-unit.source: This command removes any enabled capabilities in the app that are not in the entitlements file.
trans-unit.target: This command removes any enabled capabilities in the app that are not in the entitlements file.

trans-unit.source: If you remove capabilities that are being used by the app, it can break your app.
trans-unit.target: If you remove capabilities that are being used by the app, it can break your app.

trans-unit.source: An example of where you might remove missing capabilities is if you have a vendor-produced app that has all capabilities by default.
trans-unit.target: An example of where you might remove missing capabilities is if you have a vendor-produced app that has all capabilities by default.

trans-unit.source: Security and privacy for the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Security and privacy for the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: Use the following security and privacy best practices when you use the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: Use the following security and privacy best practices when you use the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: The signing certificate, provisioning profile and the line-of-business app you specify must be on the same Mac computer that you use to run the app wrapping tool.
trans-unit.target: The signing certificate, provisioning profile and the line-of-business app you specify must be on the same Mac computer that you use to run the app wrapping tool.

trans-unit.source: If the files are on a UNC path, ensure that these are accessible from the Mac computer.
trans-unit.target: If the files are on a UNC path, ensure that these are accessible from the Mac computer.

trans-unit.source: The path must be secured via IPsec or SMB signing.
trans-unit.target: The path must be secured via IPsec or SMB signing.

trans-unit.source: The wrapped application imported into the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console should be on the same computer that you run the tool on.
trans-unit.target: The wrapped application imported into the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console should be on the same computer that you run the tool on.

trans-unit.source: If the file is on a UNC path, ensure that it is accessible on the computer running the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console.
trans-unit.target: If the file is on a UNC path, ensure that it is accessible on the computer running the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console.

trans-unit.source: The path must be secured via IPsec or SMB signing.
trans-unit.target: The path must be secured via IPsec or SMB signing.

trans-unit.source: The environment where the app wrapping tool is downloaded from the Microsoft Download Center site needs to be secured via IPsec or SMB signing.
trans-unit.target: The environment where the app wrapping tool is downloaded from the Microsoft Download Center site needs to be secured via IPsec or SMB signing.

trans-unit.source: The app you process must come from a trust-worthy source to ensure protection against attacks.
trans-unit.target: The app you process must come from a trust-worthy source to ensure protection against attacks.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the output folder you specify in the app wrapping tool is secured, particularly if it is a remote folder.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the output folder you specify in the app wrapping tool is secured, particularly if it is a remote folder.

trans-unit.source: iOS apps that include a file upload dialog box can allow users to circumvent cut, copy and paste restrictions applied to the app.
trans-unit.target: iOS apps that include a file upload dialog box can allow users to circumvent cut, copy and paste restrictions applied to the app.

trans-unit.source: For example, a user could use the file upload dialog box to upload a screenshot of the app data.
trans-unit.target: For example, a user could use the file upload dialog box to upload a screenshot of the app data.

trans-unit.source: When users monitor the documents folder on their device from within a wrapped app, they might see a folder named **.msftintuneapplauncher**.
trans-unit.target: When users monitor the documents folder on their device from within a wrapped app, they might see a folder named **.msftintuneapplauncher**.

trans-unit.source: If this folder is changed or deleted, this might affect the correct functioning of restricted apps.
trans-unit.target: If this folder is changed or deleted, this might affect the correct functioning of restricted apps.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Decide how to prepare apps for mobile application management with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Decide how to prepare apps for mobile application management with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
trans-unit.target: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies

trans-unit.source: Use the SDK to enable apps for mobile application management
trans-unit.target: Use the SDK to enable apps for mobile application management
